description: The latest update has made it unusable.
Unsuable on Fedora 36
Last update broke it no clue why Please fix it
Great office suite for Steam Deck!
I use this applications since the OpenOffice beginnings for all my office work. LibreOffice is well maintained and under active development, with a great support community.
2 years worth of info gone. Stability is probably the most important thing on program of this nature....
It's the real alternative to Microsoft Office package.
Gets my work done. I recommend everyone to install from flathub as it keeps the software up to date. The latest update is amazing.

Currently this is the best office suite available for GNOME

I wish if LibreOffice would provide the components in a more standalone fashion without having to install Draw and Math in order to use Impress and Calc and to make the applications more easier to use like iWork by Apple

Also i would like if Fedora Workstation would expose the LibreOffice starter instead of the applications themselves since the starter is really a much more convenient way to get started from the app picker

Seeing that no seriously competing free office suite is available, this must be the choice.
It is however a dragon of an application. GUI is mildly chaotic. Icons are childlike. Internal design must be a mess, as shown by the seemingly random subset of logically expected total functionality.
It is usable, but for anybody setting out to do serious work, especially coming from Microsoft Office, it is a torment.

Sometimes Printing gets me bogged down, but I been using LibreOffice off and on for several years. With practice, I can do anything I do in any other Office program. You can write a book, do your finances, create databases for about anything and share some with your friends. Just like any other office program. Probably overkill for some, and never enough for others. Great App and well written in my books.
summary: Wonderful office app for pro and personal!

description: best office app
please include spell check feature
just three letters WPS....
it's hard to get things done with this, Google Office Suit is better
Great software

(My OS is LUBUNTU 18.04)It wasn't looking good so I've tried to make it look better and searched everywhere to make it look good. One day I was installing Ubuntu unity desktop environment. After installing it LibreOffice 
was looking better. 
How to install unity?
 Ans: Open terminal type these commands ------
				sudo apt-get update
				sudo apt-get install ubuntu-unity-desktop
Alternative for microsoft office
old version ... why only the snap version is up to date ?

I have tried to use this suit, it certainly reminds me of Office 98, because IT IS A CLON OF OFFICE 98. 20 years later and we still have this old look in the default Office suit in Linux?

WPS is by far better than this. Don't bother using this software and go straight with WPS!
summary: This is great... if we were in 2000s

excellent anti-microsoft without pay anything

very good alternative to MS office!

I use LibreOffice daily at work in my professional life and often at home for all my personal needs.
With the new interface it's really friendly to use and as powerful as MSOffice
Very useful but still needs improvements like correction and alignment for the text.
Would recommend

I love how powerful this suite is. If I need to edit any document, draft a paper, or just preview something a Windows user has sent me (yuck), I'm good to go with this program. Thanks for making quality software!

Definitely the best office suite for Linux. It provides all of the essentials and more for any office needs you might have whether it be creating professional documents, editing massive spreadsheets, or designing flawless presentations - LibreOffice does what you want and more!
summary: The best office suite available for Linux

description: seems like just basic functionality that should work, and doesn't.
its easy to use. it does the job of handling all the word, workbooks, ppt files as expected. very smooth and fast. plus its free. what more do you want
summary: does the job without any issues

description: I own the copy of whatever I produce. I do not lose anything if some cloud server dies or changes their terms. I can produce anything I want to! Ease of use and ease of customization are paramount!
summary: The best office productivity suite anywhere!

description: Nice app. Install and try it..

This was installed along with Ubuntu 18.04. And it crashed my whole system every time I used it. The only thing that responds is the cursor but everything else is frozen. So I have to do a hard shut down. My PC has more than adequate system requirements and its a fresh install.

I tried uninstalling and reinstalling and made sure all software was up to date several times. Gave up after the 9th crash. I got Openoffice instead after reading about others having similar problems on the Linux forum. Now I have no more crashes. So it was definitely Libre.

Disappointed as I used to use Libre a lot on another machine running mint. Hopefully this gets fixed soon.
summary: Crashes every time i use it

description: The only thing you can do in this version is create from a template. Then it crashes when opening a template. Also there are many templates missing. I recommend just getting the full version (200+ MB) from the libreoffice.org website as a .deb file. You can tell this install has nothing, it's only 24 MB.

Many advertise LibreOffice as a powerful Office suite even better than Microsoft Office, but the interface is outdated and needs a complete overhaul. There are other free offices which have a better interface, e.g. FreeOffice (to have the full-blown office, you must pay, cheaper than MS Office, which in my opinion is not needed for the day-to-day needs).
The contextual menus need better tools, especially the orthographic and grammatical plugins – many are useless, e.g. English version gives “hundreds” of needless words or syllables.
Despite a big effort of the team in advertising LibreOffice, in my opinion is the same as striking the air – not many companies abandoned MS Office.
You want to strike SME, you have to do similar as FreeOffice and MS Office – if not it will remain only for a few aficionados.
In other words – there is no real alternative to MS Office.
Many companies, even private people, prefer to pay a subscription and be more productive than to fiddle around with LibreOffice.
I use Linux with a virtual machine where my MS Office runs.
I highly recommend this over any of the paid for office suites out there.
unable to see usb drive after hitting save as, at side bar
I am running this app in Ubuntu 19.01, app is not working properly.Sometimes hanging problem & many more issues i found.

The icons were way too small and menu type couldn't be read. I installed the regular version from the terminal and all is well. 
sudo apt install libreoffice, just that easy.
Easy to use when you're familiar with Microsoft Word
it doesnt open documents that aby does. non sense.
This is a great alternative to Microsoft Office.
Very light and fast, but there are compatibility issues with files created by MS office.
the marathi font is not available even after changing language in options and installing language support pack
good for edit / create pages / docoments but one problem once install , not uninstalling ! ubuntu store cannot delete libre office apps .
Totalmente funcional no meu Lubuntu 18.04.x i386

plz tell me i need to know

not top heavy or cumbersome. Astonishing to find it is FREE
Great app, i recommend!

Debian shows 1:6.1.5-3+deb10u6 and never updated.

I use LibreOffice daily. It's a great alternative to M$. I would like to see it updated in Debian's software repository to take advantage of any security and feature updates. Thanks!

description: Generally speaking, its way too primitive.... I wish it was better, but its not the case.
does everything I need, and a great deal more. I think it is more user friendly M Office, and probably more secure. And I can afford it!
It keeps closing unexpectedly, causing me to lose the state of the document I'd been working on. I'm getting nothing done!
Great office app with all the features I need.
A wonderdul app
summary: Great to see flatpak is at version 6 also

description: Its interface could have a better design though.

I've written countless papers in Writer, and keep a budget sheet in Calc. It's basically all one needs. There are some issues with compatibility with MS Office documents, but on the flip side I've used LibreOffice to fix damaged MS Docs. All in all, it's pretty awesome.
error reading data from TLS socket: A TLS packet with unexpected lenght was recieved
It is the best open-source office suite, but not as intuitive Microsoft Office. Despite this, with a search engine it is usable, at least.
Its an awesome replacement for microsoft office

Surely flatpak is a faster way for software vendors to push updates to its users and is not targeted for a single distribution. 
Recommend everyone to install the flatpak version of libreoffice which is truely amazing in itself.

Does all I need and is continuously improved.
There Several ways to use it via appimage or flathub, ppa or snap.
Love it. ...
summary: Does all I need and is continuously improved

description: The default LibreOffice menu setup is dated and clunky, but it can be customized to basically anything you want. Once you're familiar with the office suite, you can do anything you would do with microsoft and a few things microsoft can't do (embedded pdf documents). There are still round-trip compatibility issues with microsoft office.

For openSUSE both Leap 15.1 and Tumbleweed (as of July 2019), LibreOffice has a bug that'll be serious for any spreadsheet user: You can't move a row or column. In the Flatpack, this feature works correctly (drag'n'drop while holding Alt). However, it looks a little weird for KDE user.
At my work place I have to deal with Office 365 and the rest of Microsoft Office. LibreOffice is a breath of fresh air. The layout is familiar and it's light on resources.
The flatpak version works much better than the ones Ubuntu packages.

I'm thrilled by LibreOffice. I only wish it was more popular with more supporters so they had more income to improve it a bit more. Its user interface is slightly quirky, but overall, i still give it 5 stars. It suffers from being written in Java in my opinion, as it can sometimes be slow and buggy. but fortunately this is very rare. when it does crash, it recovers the file i was working on almost every time. this is the best of its kind, if you ask me. i prefer this over Microsoft's Office. I much prefer to donate $10 a year to LibreOffice than pay a Microsoft subscription for their privacy invasive software. And LibreOffice opens MS file type too. This really is absolutely a beauty of a piece of software!!
summary: best of its kind to my knowledge

description: I'm getting horrible lag and stuttering on a capable machine and the cpu usage rises to 90% while typing or scrolling. I hope it will be fixed soon because I really like it.

I began with OpenOffice at early days of 2006... and changed to LibreOffice when it moves to.
I love it because interface and use of it still the same for 15 years.
Just a super productivity tool.
poor appearance in KDE and VERY poor if you use dark stile for KDE

Three steps of scoring:

LO is a great MSOffice replacement. I use mostly Calc and Writer, and overall it does what it should, it does it well, although there's room for improvement. E.g. cell borders in Calc is impressively clunky to use.
- Score for being a good MSOffice replacement: 4/5

In KDE, this Flatpak (like most others) is seemingly unable to both inherit and select a Dark system theme. You can set Breeze (Dark) icons, but that's it.
On the positive side, you're not forced to use the GTK theme/style, so at least there's progress.
- Score for not being able to theme correctly: 3/5

The fact that all settings with regards to dates, units and such doesn't by default adhere to ISO standards, but instead use the archaic "imperial" system (inches, sunday as first day of week, mm-dd-yyyy for date), is just embarassing in 2021. Especially considering that The Document Foundation is based in Germany. (And no, my system locale it not set to the imperial units).
- Score for not using ISO standards/for using outdated units of measurements and dates: 2/5
summary: Doesn't inherit Dark Theme in KDE

description: I have been using it for years and I do not regret! It is awesome.

Works very well with Finnish Spellchecker Flatpak & Zotero. For some reason had huge problems with getting Voikko to work with repository LibreOffice (although it works alright onmy laptop), but this combo works perfectly.
It is free and opensource. It is also useful and works greatly.

Vollweriger Ersatz für Microsoft Office (auch die Meinung von Bekannten, welche LibreOffice beruflich einsetzen).
Ich persönlich nutze es für den privaten Gebrauch schon mehrere Jahre und es funktionierte bis jetzt immer, ohne Probleme!

Writer ersetzt fast alles, was man von Word erwartet, Calc hat die meisten Formeln von Excel. Dateien von MS werden anstandslos geöffnet. Kleinere Bugs bestehen, aber, hey, es ist kostenlos. Großartiges Programm, dass mit dem Vorbild fast immer mithalten kann. Danke an die Entwickler.

ist super mit allem was man braucht
und dazu noch kostenlos
ich bin kein Experte, was die Microsoft Programme betrifft, aber LibreOffice hat immer alles geschafft, was man erwarten würde.

In Writer und Calc bisher als "Normalanwender" keine Probleme. Anders sieht das bei Impress aus: Hier wurden Seiten von MS Office (*.ppt) nur ziemlich verändert im Layout dargestellt. Wäre toll, wenn sich das beheben lassen könnte. Ein herzliches Danke an die Entwicklergemeinschaft!

Klar, dass ich OOO und LO schon seit Jahren nutze und ggü MSO bevorzuge. Ich habe nur in 2 Punkten Nachteile:
Access ist nicht implementiert.
Der Serienbrief (etwas komplizierter, nicht nur Adressen in der DB) ist jedesmal eine Herausforderung.
Ich habe noch nie MS Office bzw. Win noch nie genutz und ich finde, das LibreOffice perfekt ist.
Eigentlich total cool doch bei mir fehlt Impress
Es war mir nach 4 Std. suche und recherche nicht möglich, die das Programm eine deutsche Bedienoberfläche umzustellen. Zeitdiebe und unfähige Programmierer.
Auf jeden Fall kein Schrott. Wer so was schreibt, sollte die Finger von Linux lassen.
Deutsche Oberfläche einfach installieren, zählt zu den einfachen Dingen bei Linux. Das Prigramm ist besser als MS Office und kostenlos...
Muy buena pero no he podido actualizar a la versión 6.0

La verdad que podría mejorar bastante, le faltan opciones, le diseño es bastante antiguo, y si haces un trabajo en WORD, al abrirlo con writter se desconfigura, tienen que mejorar eso, de resto esta muy bien ;)
Todo marcha bien pero al abrir Writter en Debian la aplicación se cierra.

En KDE no se pueden volver abrir documentos que fueron firmados digitalmente. Se nota de la ausencia de agregar bordes personalizados artisticos, algo muy utilizado para esquematizaciones de libros. Tambien falta opciones de agregar paginas de portadas personalizadas.
Gran trabajo, gracias a todos sus desarrolladores!

He dejado de usar word. Es tan fácil como descargarse libreoffice allí donde vas y ya puedes abrir tus documentos, en vez de instalar MS office y su crack, el cual en muchos sitios públicos no te deja instalar. A día de hoy Libreoffice es en funcionalidad igual que MS office, e incluso añade alguna funcionalidad que no vas a encontrar en la de MS. Por no mencionar que se actualiza mucho más a menudo que la de MS.
está genial. nada que envidiar a microsoft
Es importante permitir actualizar a la versión estable mas reciente.
Todos los trabajos los hago con Libre
Excelente software desde hoy aquí realizo todo, ¡felicidades!
Esta bien y todo pero en lo personal en mi computadora me va muy lento y es muy incomodo trabajar así.
Muy buena aplicación, la recomiendo. Nunca falla para hacer mis trabajos.
Está actualizándose periódicamente, y eso nos permite estar al día con las novedades que tiene. En comparación con otr@s sistemas operativos (los privativos) es una gran ventaja.
Nada que envidiarle a la Suite de Office en Windows

Hoy, muy confiable.
Habre, edita y guarda documentos de software privativo sin 'sorpresas'. Para evitarlas cuando debes editar estos documentos en el W del Ventanuco, guardar como Work '97-2003
Excelente herramienta! Muy profecional y confiable.

Este editor de texto es tan versatíl como el word; y el resto de complementos de la suit de Microsoft. Para las táreas habituales es más que suficiente. La uso con relativa frecuencia y no hecho de menos el word.
¿ya probaste el modo pestaña? nada que envidiarle a MSOffice
La mejor suite ofimática. Plena funcionalidad, múltiples opciones, versátil, intuitiva y completa.

La suite libre office esta muy bien pero estuve haciendo un texto con emoyi y mi sorpresa fue que cuando lo pasas a PDF no refleja los emoyi del texto, por eso fue mi puntuacion un 3 ya que con worl si los refleja y eso detalles son los que mas tienen que cuidar los desarrolladores de libre office
Gracias al de arriba por inventar flatpak

Este programa lo utilizo para la universidad, cuando trabajo solo no hay ningun problema, por lo regular mando los trabajos en pdf, el problema estaba cuando me mandaban archivos hechos en windows, entonces Pues yo me fui a un windows 10, me fui a la carpeta donde se encuentran todos los tipos de letras, las copie en un usb, me fui a mi kde neon, y las instale todas, de esa forma tengo todas las letras de windows en mi distro, eso hizo que fuera mas compatible con archivos hechos con microsoft office y listo, todo funciona muy bien, solo que el diseño del programa no me termina de convencer, pero su funcionalidad es de 10.
Error grafico de los menus, no se ven correctamente los iconos.

Es simplemente la más completa de las suites ofimáticas libres. Esto lo reconocería cualquier persona que halla trabajado con ella y con cualquiera otra. Siempre por debajo, únicamente, de la colosal MS Office, pero eso es otra historia.
Lo de la apariencia "antigua" se soluciona con un par de comandos, nada del otro jueves. Incluso puede imitar la apariencia de la de Microsoft (https://www.softzone.es/programas/utilidades/libreoffice-tema-office/)
Esa apariencia sosa tiene que ver con la distribución que la sirve y su intención velada de colar otra (la "suya"). Pasa con Deepin cuando lo que intenta es "vendernos" "su" WPS Office, o con KDE Neón que hace lo propio son su Calligra. No es muy honesto, puede incluso que irritante, pero es legal...
Muy bueno LibreOffiice con la nueva actualización se corrigieron varias fallas, funciona bien y mayor conpactibilidad, tambien tiene buena interfaz y multiples opciones de configuración.
Me encanta lo bien que funciona!!
alors que ça allait tres bien, cette nouvelle version a de gros problemes d'affichages et d'options non fonctionnelles ou difficiles a trouver. impress est devenu ingerableichag
interface a revoire

Au moins avec la police Cantarell, il est impossible de mettre les carctères en italique.

Pierre
Gratuit, simple, complet et efficace!
J'ai Kali Linux, j'ai installe Libre Office via le terminal, et le programme charge mais ne se lance jamais!
Un indispensable pour travailler sur debian.
Writer ne se lance pas sur une debian 9.0.0 i386 mais les autres modules fonctionnent parfaitement.
Tout est dit...

J'utilise quotidiennement la suite LibreOffice. Notamment Calc et Writer. Deux applications indispensables qui répondent bien à mes besoins, Je fais aussi usage de StarBasic (le langage macro de la suite Office) qui est très performant et fonctionnel.
Pourquoi se faire chier avec Microsoft Office quand on a mieux pour gratuit ?

Libre office est un fork de Open office.
Une suite bureautique déclinée pour les systèmes d'exploitations les plus communs. Compatible avec les produits (privateurs) Microsoft Office et , bien entendu, avec le standard libre OpenDocument.
La suite évolue et est maintenue.
Un outil bureautique de haute qualité sur Debian.
Ne fonctionne qu'avec Java, que j'ai téléchargé, mais que je n'arrive pas à instaler
The only one for me since 2005 ! (am I so old ?) No wasting time, just productivity with a lot of useful tools ...
tres bonne suite

Libreoffice est très bien pour les petits travaux, mais il manque quand même des choses que d'autre outils dispose :
- dans writer, pouvoir grouper une image (positionner au dessus du texte) avec des éléments situé autour (fleche, rectangle de texte)
- dans calc, un vrai dédoublonage des données, une mise en forme tableau automatique (alternance de couleur des lignes)
Il y en a d'autre, qui m’embête au quotidien m'empêchant de travailler correctement.

Inutile de payer une blinde et de vous faire pister à mort par Microsoft Office, quand on son alternative open-source, gratuit, qui fonctionne et qui est compatible avec des documents d'une personne qui travaille sur Office.
pourquoi pas en français
Cette version est la 6.07 (2018), LibreOffice en est dans sa version stable la plus récente à la 6.4.1. Il serait bon de mettre à jour les dépôts.
trop bien fonctionnalité parfaite pas besion de l'acheter
summary: je recommande a tout monde ce logiciel

description: J'ai abonndonné Microsoft Office depuis 6 ans et tout ce que je faisais sous MO je le fais sur LibreOffice. Grâce à son exceptionnelle communautée je vais même plus loin. Ne craignez pas les quelques jours nécessaire pour s'approprier l'interface et trouver les fonctionnalitées nommées différement, s'en en vaut la peine.
summary: LA suite bureautique multiplateforme par excellence

description: C est en tierement bien comme apli mais par contre moi il se mets en anglais donc c est un peuc chiant.Est quand je vais dans les reglage de la langue je peux pas choisir la langue sa me maraque que anglais est le reste est en fracais mais l app reste en anglais
Pour la version française, il faut installer le paquet libreoffice-l10n-fr

Bonjour ! Je ne sait pas si les développeurs lisent ceci, mais je pose comme-même mon avis !

J'adore LibreOffice, je l'utilise depuis plusieurs années sur mes machines, et récemment j'ai voulu prendre la version Flatpak (celle-ci) pour avoir les dèrnières mises à jour, mais il y à un problème : Le thème de LibreOffice (Flatpak) ne respecte pas le thème du système (je suis sur KDE Neon), il utilise Adwaita comme thème et Brise comme icones (Etrangement sa à bien fonctionné avec les icones...), et non pas le thème Breeze ou Breeze Dark ! Mais le pire dans tout sa c'est que le thème Adwaita ne fonctionne même pas correctement, il manque des boutons et des flèches (surtout des flèches) à beaucoups d'endroits et il y a des petites inconsistances :(

Si quelqu'un aurais une solution à me proposer sa serait super simpa !

PS : Je sait que puisque c'est un Flatpak, LibreOffice ne peux pas accéder a touts mes fichiers sur mon PC (donc les thèmes), mais je ne sait pas comment faire en sorte que LibreOffice puisse accéder à ces fichiers ! Et même si j'y arriverai, je ne sait pas si sa fonctionnerais...
summary: Bien mais ne respecte pas mon thème

description:
SE: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS 64 bits

Fonctionne parfaitement ! Une alternative géniale à MS Office mais LIBRE et Open Source, tout comme Open Office. Je ne comprends toujours pas pourquoi les entreprises utilisent MS office, alors que tous leurs tableurs et rapports peuvent être détournés et consultés par MS car programme propriétaire...cherchez l'erreur.
one of the best

Но есть свои недостатки:
Текст из таблиц в экселе например не переносится в ячейки в ворде, либо копируется весь в первую ячейку. В обратном направлении тоже кривовато. Автоподбор работает на ура, как будто мысли читает. По скорости быстрее.
summary: Как альтернатива офису от майкрософт пойдет

description: Есть проблемы с совместимостью с новыми документами MSO 2019, ну и означенная выше проблема в таблицах. А так вне конкуренции для нашей любимой ОС.
На удаётся удалить. Реальный LibreOffice теперь не может установиться.
Я не знаю ребят, я думал оно должно работать примерно также как павер поинт. А я даже ячейки в таблице не могу объединить. И ещё таблицы в impress тормозят ж у т к о

description: Пытаюсь удалить сей дивный софт за ненадобностью, а система пишет что не удалось разрешить зависимости.
